Module the_project
Package room_features

Class FeatureManipulator

java.lang.Object
room_features.FeatureManipulator
All Implemented Interfaces:
AddStandard, RemoveStandard, Reset, Set
public class FeatureManipulator extends Object implements AddStandard, RemoveStandard, Set, Reset
Follows the Single Responsibility Principle as it has the sole responsibility of manipulating the features of a room;

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    FeatureManipulator(RoomFeatures rf)
    initiates a FeatureManipulator object by using a RoomFeatures object;

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    addEntry()
    Adds a new feature to this room by taking in input feature name and status/quantity from the user (hotel staff member); Searches for existing features which matches input; If match is found, feature already exists in this room and error message asking if user wants to update feature quantity comes up; If match is not found, feature does not exist in this room and new feature object is created and instantiated, and number of features increments by 1;
    void
    removeEntry()
    Removes existing feature that is not a core feature; Searches for existing features which matches input feature_name; If found and feature_name is a core feature, error message is displayed; If found and feature_name is not a core feature, feature_name index is used to remove feature; If not found, error message is displayed;
    void
    resetArray()
    Resets array list containing room features that are not core features to default (cleared); If array list is empty, error message is displayed; If array list is not empty, array list is cleared;
    void
    set()
    Updates feature status of existing non-core feature; Searches for existing features that matches input feature_name; If found and feature_name is a core feature, error message is displayed; If found and feature_name is not a core feature, a message displayed queues the user for new status input for this feature; If not found, error message is displayed;

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      initiates a FeatureManipulator object by using a RoomFeatures object;

  • Method Details

    • addEntry

      public void addEntry() throws ArrayException
      Adds a new feature to this room by taking in input feature name and status/quantity from the user (hotel staff member); Searches for existing features which matches input; If match is found, feature already exists in this room and error message asking if user wants to update feature quantity comes up; If match is not found, feature does not exist in this room and new feature object is created and instantiated, and number of features increments by 1;
      Specified by:
      addEntry in interface AddStandard
      Throws:
      ArrayException - occurs upon a duplicate entry

    • removeEntry

      public void removeEntry() throws ArrayException
      Removes existing feature that is not a core feature; Searches for existing features which matches input feature_name; If found and feature_name is a core feature, error message is displayed; If found and feature_name is not a core feature, feature_name index is used to remove feature; If not found, error message is displayed;
      Specified by:
      removeEntry in interface RemoveStandard
      Throws:
      ArrayException - occurs when no entry found for its request to be removed

    • set

      public void set() throws ArrayException
      Updates feature status of existing non-core feature; Searches for existing features that matches input feature_name; If found and feature_name is a core feature, error message is displayed; If found and feature_name is not a core feature, a message displayed queues the user for new status input for this feature; If not found, error message is displayed;
      Specified by:
      set in interface Set
      Throws:
      ArrayException - occurs when there are any errors upon the overriding of entry in the array

    • resetArray

      public void resetArray()
      Resets array list containing room features that are not core features to default (cleared); If array list is empty, error message is displayed; If array list is not empty, array list is cleared;
      Specified by:
      resetArray in interface Reset
